Creating a Tacacs Provider

 1. In the Domain Configuration screen, ensure that the Realm selection is Tacacs, and then select Provider Group from the list. click +. Tacacs Providers screen is displayed.

 2. In the Tacacs Providers screen, click the + icon. Add/Edit Tacacs Provider page is displayed.

 3. In the Add/Edit Tacacs Provider page, enter the required fields according to your provider.

Figure 3-8 TACACS Provider

Table 3-3 Tacacs Parameters

Field Name

Description

Hostname

The hostname/IP address on which the Tacacs provider resides.

Order

The provider sequential order to authenticate users in Cisco UCS ADA domain. The sequential order for the provider can be defined up to 16.

Key

The SSL encryption key for the Tacacs database.

Confirm Key

The SSL encryption confirmation key for the Tacacs database.

Port

The port through which Cisco UCS communicates with the Tacacs database. The default port number is 49.

Timeout

This defines the time limit for the web session to be terminated beyond the refresh request time period.

The time must be defined in secs between 60 and 172800. The default time period is 7200 secs.

 4. Click Save to create an Tacacs provider.

Similarly, repeat step 2 and 3 to create as many TACACS provider(s) until you have created all providers.

 5. In the TACACS Providers page, select the required provider(s) you wish to include in the group.

 6. Click the > to add the providers in the TACACS Providers Groups.

You can use the X to remove providers from the group.

 7. After you have added all desired providers to the provider group, click Save & Return.
